title: byte[edit]
content: byte is a keyword which designates the 8 bit signed integer primitive type.The java.lang.Byte class is the nominal wrapper class when you need to store a byte value but an object reference is required.Syntax:byte <variable-name> = <integer-value>;For example:byte b = 65;orbyte b = 'A'The number 65 is the code for 'A' in ASCII.See also:Java Programming/Primitive Types
